title: Not so swinging: how the 60s really looked – in pictures
text:
Eastbourne Carnival, circa 1967

‘Photography can be a mirror and reflect life as it is,’ wrote Ray-Jones, “but I also think that perhaps it is possible to walk, like Alice, through the looking glass, and find another kind of world with the camera.’ The English Seen by Tony Ray-Jones is at The Martin Parr Foundation, Bristol, 16 October to 21 December. An accompanying book, Tony Ray-Jones , is out this month. All photographs: Tony Ray-Jones/National Science & Media Museum/Science & Society Picture Library
description: Before his death at the age of just 30, Tony Ray-Jones travelled through England photographing what he saw as a disappearing way of life, as the 60s drew to an end. A new exhibition marks the pivotal contribution he made to British documentary photography
